translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Terms

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  hetu sampayutta duka

original: Hetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetusampayuttaṁ
analyzed: hetu sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetu sampayutta
translated: With root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause arises. With root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause and with root-cause arises.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetusampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetu sampayuttam dhamma
translated: With a state without root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause arises. With a state without root-cause as condition, a state with root-cause arises.

original: paṭicca nahetusampayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Hetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuvippayuttaṁ
analyzed: paṭicca na hetu sampayutto ca na hetu vippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  hetu vippayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetu vippayutta
translated: With a state without root-cause as condition, a state with root-cause and a state without root-cause arise.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuvippayuttaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetu vippayuttam dhamma
translated: With a state with root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause arises. With a state with root-cause as condition, a state with root-cause arises.

original: paṭicca nahetusampayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭicca na hetu sampayutto ca na hetu vippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a state with root-cause as condition, a state with root-cause and a state without root-cause arise.

original: Hetusampayuttañca hetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetusampayutto dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: hetu sampayuttañca hetu vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: With a state with root-cause and a state without root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause arises.

original: hetupaccayā. Hetusampayuttañca hetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetuvippayutto
analyzed: hetu paccayā hetu sampayuttañca hetu vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: Dependent on a cause as condition, a causally related and a causally unrelated🔽state arises. Dependent on a cause as condition, a causally related and a causally unrelated

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetusampayuttañca hetuvippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nahetusampayutto ca nahetuvippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetu sampayuttañca hetu vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca  na hetu sampayutto ca na hetu vippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: state arises. (Abbreviated.)🔽Nine in the causal, six in the object, five in the predominance, …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate nava. (Sahajātavārampi …pe… pañhāvārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate nava sahajāta vārampi pe pañhā vārampi vitthāretabba
translated: unobscured-indeterminate dhammas. (The section headed) “in association” should be elaborated in the same way as the section on the root-causeless. (The remaining sections are to be elaborated in the same way as in §1.)
